disclaimer: This is informational only and does not constitute legal advice. Court procedures may vary by county.
tenantProtectionNote: New Jersey has the STRONGEST tenant protections in the United States. Use these defenses fully.

overview.name: New Jersey Eviction Process Overview
overview.importantNote: Landlord MUST have 'good cause' - lease expiration alone is NOT grounds for eviction

steps.name: Determine Good Cause
steps.description: Landlord must have one of 13 statutory grounds to evict

steps.name: Notice to Cease (if required)
steps.description: For lease violations, landlord must first give notice to stop conduct
steps.timeline: Must be given before Notice to Quit

steps.name: Notice to Quit
steps.timeline: 30 days for non-payment; varies for other grounds

steps.name: File Complaint
steps.description: Landlord files complaint in Special Civil Part

steps.name: Court Hearing
steps.description: Both parties present evidence; landlord must prove good cause

steps.name: Judgment
steps.description: Court rules for landlord or tenant

steps.name: Warrant of Removal
steps.description: If judgment for landlord, warrant issued after 3 business days

steps.name: Physical Eviction
steps.description: Court officer executes warrant and removes tenant
steps.timeline: After warrant issued; usually within days

goodCauseRequirement.title: Good Cause Required for ALL Evictions
goodCauseRequirement.description: Landlord cannot evict just because lease expired or ended
goodCauseRequirement.importance: This is the strongest tenant protection in the nation

paymentStopsEviction.title: Payment Stops Non-Payment Eviction
paymentStopsEviction.description: Paying all rent owed BEFORE judgment stops the eviction completely
paymentStopsEviction.timing: Anytime before court enters judgment for possession

retaliationPresumption.title: 90-Day Retaliation Presumption
retaliationPresumption.description: Eviction within 90 days of protected activity presumed retaliatory

timeline.curePeriod: Anytime before judgment - payment STOPS eviction

defenseOptions.name: Improper Notice
checklist: Was notice in writing?
Did notice state amount of rent due?
Was notice properly served?
Was full 30-day period given?
Does notice comply with statutory requirements?

defenseOptions.name: Payment Stops Eviction
defenseOptions.description: Paying ALL rent due before judgment STOPS the eviction
checklist: What is the total amount claimed?
Can you pay before judgment?
Do you have documentation of payment?
defenseOptions.importantNote: This is a COMPLETE DEFENSE - eviction must be dismissed

defenseOptions.name: Breach of Warranty of Habitability
defenseOptions.description: Property has serious conditions affecting habitability
checklist: Are there conditions affecting health/safety?
Is property weatherproof and watertight?
Are plumbing, heating, electrical working?
Did you notify landlord of conditions in writing?
Did landlord fail to make repairs?
defenseOptions.caveat: May reduce or eliminate rent owed; strong defense in NJ

defenseOptions.name: Truth in Renting Violation
defenseOptions.description: Landlord failed to provide required Truth in Renting statement
checklist: Did you receive Truth in Renting statement at lease signing?
Was it in English (and Spanish if requested)?
Do you have the statement or proof you didn't receive it?
documentation: Statement about what was provided at lease signing

defenseOptions.name: Security Deposit Violation - Use as Rent
defenseOptions.description: If landlord violated security deposit law, deposit can be applied to rent
checklist: Did you pay a security deposit?
Was deposit placed in proper NJ bank account?
Did landlord notify you of deposit location?
Is landlord paying required interest?
Were deductions properly itemized?
defenseOptions.effect: Tenant may deduct deposit from rent owed

defenseOptions.name: Retaliatory Eviction
defenseOptions.description: Eviction filed in response to tenant exercising legal rights
checklist: Did you recently complain about conditions?
Did you report code violations?
Did you contact housing authorities?
Did you join a tenant organization?
Was eviction filed within 90 days of protected activity?

defenseOptions.name: Discriminatory Eviction
defenseOptions.description: Eviction based on protected class under NJ Law Against Discrimination
checklist: Are you in a protected class?
Is landlord treating you differently than others?
Are similarly situated non-protected tenants treated differently?
Is there evidence of discriminatory statements?

timeline.noticeToQuit: After violation continues despite Notice to Cease

defenseOptions.name: No Notice to Cease
defenseOptions.description: Landlord must give Notice to Cease BEFORE Notice to Quit
checklist: Did you receive a Notice to Cease first?
Did Notice to Cease describe the violation?
Did Notice to Cease demand the conduct stop?
Did violation continue after Notice to Cease?
documentation: Copy of Notice to Cease (or proof none given)
defenseOptions.strength: MANDATORY PROCEDURE - case should be dismissed

defenseOptions.name: Violation Cured After Notice to Cease
defenseOptions.description: Violation was corrected after Notice to Cease was given
checklist: What was the alleged violation?
Did you stop the conduct after Notice to Cease?
Did violation resume (required for eviction)?

defenseOptions.name: No Actual Violation
defenseOptions.description: Alleged conduct does not violate lease terms
checklist: What specific lease provision is cited?
Does your conduct actually violate that provision?
Is the lease provision clear?

noGoodCause.description: Landlord must allege one of the 13 statutory grounds

defenseOptions.name: No Good Cause Stated
defenseOptions.description: Complaint fails to allege one of the 13 statutory grounds
checklist: What ground is alleged in the complaint?
Does the ground match the facts?
Is lease expiration the only reason given?
defenseOptions.strength: CASE DISMISSAL - good cause is MANDATORY

defenseOptions.name: Lease Expiration is Not Good Cause
defenseOptions.description: End of lease term alone is NOT grounds for eviction in New Jersey
checklist: Did landlord claim lease ended as reason for eviction?
Is there any other alleged ground?
Has landlord proved any statutory ground?

defenseOptions.name: Building Does Not Qualify
defenseOptions.description: Ground 8 only applies to owner-occupied 2-3 family homes
checklist: How many units in building?
Does owner live in building?
Is building properly classified?

defenseOptions.name: Landlord Acting in Bad Faith
defenseOptions.description: Landlord does not genuinely intend to occupy unit
checklist: Has landlord done this before?
Is unit immediately re-rented after eviction?
Is there evidence landlord won't actually move in?

critical.action: Document date; prepare to defend; seek legal help
Note court date; prepare answer and evidence
PAY ALL RENT before judgment to STOP eviction

specialCivilPart.name: Superior Court - Special Civil Part
specialCivilPart.description: Landlord-Tenant Section handles all eviction cases
procedures: Case tracked separately from other civil matters
Judge rules same day in most cases
Landlord bears burden of proving good cause
specialCivilPart.burdenOfProof: LANDLORD must prove good cause - tenant does not need to prove anything initially

newark.name: Newark-Specific Protections
notes: Right to Counsel Program for income-eligible tenants
